name: Oxalicum acidum
Relationship: Compare: ARS.; COLCH.; ARG.; PIC-AC.; CICER ARIETINUM - Chick-pea - (Lithiasis, jaundice, liver affections; diuretic). SCOLOPENDRA - Centipede - (terrible pains in back and loins, extending down limbs; return periodically, commencing in head, to toes. Angina pectoris. Inflammation, pain and gangrene. Pustules and abscesses). CAESIUM - (Pain in lumbar region and testicle. Headache, darting through temples. Diarrhoea and colic. Languor.) LIME WATER - Antidote to poisoning of Oxal. acid.
Modalities: Worse: left side; slightest touch; light; shaving

Heart: Palpitation and dyspnoea in organic heart disease; worse, when thinking of it
Heart symptoms alternate with aphonia, angina pectoris; sharp, lancinating pain in left lung coming on suddenly, depriving of breath
Precordial pains which dart to the left shoulder
Eyes: Severe pain in eyes; feel expanded
Respiratory: Paralysis of the tensors of vocal cord
Sharp pain through lower region of left lung, extending down to epigastrium
Breathing spasmodic, with constriction of larynx and chest
Stomach: Bitter and sour eructation, worse at night
Violent pain in epigastrium discharge of flatus relieves
Burning pain, extending upwards; slightest touch causes excruciating pain
Gastralgia, pyrosis, sensation of coldness below epigastrium
Head: Sense of heat
Headache, before and during stool
Confusion and vertigo
Urine: Burning in urethra and pain in glans when urinating
Must urinate when thinking of it
Abdomen: Burning in small spots in abdomen
Pain in upper part and region of navel two hours after eating, with much flatulence
Skin: Sensitive, smarting and soreness, worse shaving; mottled, marbled in circular patches
Extremities: Multiple cerebral and posterior spinal sclerosis
Drawing and lancinating pains shooting down extremities
Lancinating pains in various parts; jerking pains
Pains start from spine and extend through extremities
Male: Terrible neuralgic pains in spermatic cord

details: Although certain oxalates are constant constituents of vegetable food and of the human body, the acid itself is a violent poison when taken internally, producing gastroenteritis, motor paralysis, collapse, stupor and death. Influences the spinal cord, and produces motor paralysis. Pains very violent, IN SPOTS (KALI. BICH.) WORSE, motion, and THINKING OF THEM. PERIODICAL REMISSIONS. Spasmodic symptoms of throat and chest. RHEUMATISM OF LEFT SIDE. NEURASTHENIA. Tuberculosis.
